title: Australia's coral wonderland (A)
creator_contributor_role: Australian National Film Board, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Great Barrier Reef (Qld.)

Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Wildlife cinematography
description: A picture of the life along the Great Barrier Reef; an aboriginal corroboree; flora and fauna on a trip down the Russell River; micro-photographs of animal life; underwater cinematography of an octopus, sea worms, a feathered star fish, a king schnapper, hermit crabs, sea anemones and other forms of life; scenes of turtles building nests and laying eggs; hatching of young turtles. Commentary by Wilfrid Thomas; sound by Mervyn Murphy and photography by Noel Monkman FRMS.
